DataElement.preferredName: Failure Resolve Recover Patient Chemotherapy Targeted Molecular Therapy Past 4 Week Occurrence Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify that a patient has received chemotherapy or targeted small molecule therapy with the past 4 weeks prior to study entry, or has not recovered from adverse events associated with agent(s) administered more than 4 weeks earlier.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Failure Resolve Patient Chemotherapy Targeted Molecular Therapy Past 4 Week Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A lack of occurrence or performance._One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._Cancer therapies designed to act upon specific molecules in metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread._On the inside; contained in._Before the present time._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4_Any period of seven consecutive days._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A lack of occurrence or performance.:One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A lack of occurrence or performance.
One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Chemotherapy Targeted Molecular Therapy Within Past Integer::4 Week Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term is used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is particularly used to refer to the use of chemical-based agents to treat cancer. Antineoplastic chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells. Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity.:Cancer therapies designed to act upon specific molecules in metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread.:On the inside; contained in.:Before the present time.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4:Any period of seven consecutive days.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
Cancer therapies designed to act upon specific molecules in metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have had chemotherapy or targ
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have had chemotherapy or targeted small molecule therapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study or those who have not recovered from adverse events due to agent administered more than 4 weeks earlier.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior targeted small molecule therapy within 2 weeks of enrollment or not recovered (i.e., less than or equal to Grade 1 or at baseline) from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks prior to enrollment?
